No UL for infants. Unit is mcg Dietary Folate Equivalents.
UL applies to synthetic folic acid from supplements/fortified foods only.
Women capable of becoming pregnant should get 400 mcg folic acid daily from supplements/fortified foods.
Critical for prevention of neural tube defects.
No UL established for B12.
Adults >50 should meet RDA primarily through fortified foods or supplements due to malabsorption of food-bound B12.

Higher requirement for postmenopausal women to mitigate bone loss.

High requirement to supply fetus and increased blood volume.

No UL for potassium from food. CKD patients must restrict intake.

CDRR 2300 mg/day for ages 14+. AHA optimal goal is 1500 mg/day for most adults.
